components.html: You should only complete this form if you experienced housing discrimination because of your race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability, or familial status.
components.label: Content
HTML
components.content: Learn more about housing discrimination

components.html:
Before you get started.

Have you been discriminated against in housing?

You have 1 year since the discrimination happened to submit a complaint to us.

components.html:
Check every reason below that applies.

You can be discriminated against just because someone thinks you’re a certain race, religion, or other choice below — or because your family or friend is.
components.label: Content

components.html:
Race 
Racial discrimination means being treated unfairly because you are:

  • White;
  • Black or African American;
  • Asian;
  • American Indian or Alaska Native;
  • Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander; or 
  • a mixture of two or more of these groups. 

Racial discrimination also includes being treated unfairly because of personal characteristics associated with race or because you are married to (or associated with) a person of a specific race.

Color
Color discrimination means being treated unfairly because of your skin color. While race and color overlap, they are not the same. People of various races and ethnicities may experience discrimination because of their skin color. This type of discrimination may occur within the same race.  

Religion
Religious discrimination means being treated unfairly because of your religious beliefs. This can include both the practice and non-practice of a religion. 

Sex 
Sex discrimination means being treated unfairly or differently because of your sex. This includes both harassment because of a person’s sex and sexual harassment. 

National Origin 
National origin discrimination means being treated unfairly because you:

  • are from a specific country or part of the world; 
  • speak a certain language or have an accent when you speak; 
  • are of a certain ethnic background; or
  • appear to be of a certain ethnic background (even if you are not).

National origin discrimination may also include being treated unfairly because you are married to (or associated with) a person of a specific national origin.

Familial Status
Familial status discrimination means being treated unfairly because:

  • your family includes at least one child under 18 years old;
  • you are pregnant; or
  • you are in the process of adopting a child.

Disability
Disability discrimination means being treated unfairly because you:

  • have a physical or mental disability which substantially limits any major life activity;
  • have a record of a physical or mental disability; or
  • are viewed as having a physical or mental disability.

The Fair Housing Act also requires certain new multifamily dwellings to be accessible for persons with disabilities. 

Note: Disability discrimination does not include being treated unfairly because you currently use (or are addicted to) an illegal controlled substance. Controlled substances are defined in Section 102 of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 802).
components.label: Content
Race
components.tooltip: Example: A seller refused to sell you their home because you are Black.

components.label: Color
components.tooltip: Example: A realtor only showed you apartments in certain neighborhoods because you have dark skin.

components.label: Religion
components.tooltip: Example: A landlord denied your rental application because you wear a hijab (religious headscarf).

components.label: National Origin
components.tooltip: Example: A mortgage loan officer denied you a loan or imposed different terms and conditions because you have an accent when you speak English.

components.label: Sex
components.tooltip: Example: An owner evicted you for rejecting their sexual advances.

components.label: Disability
components.tooltip: Example: A landlord won’t waive the pet fee for your assistance animal.

components.label: Familial Status
components.tooltip: Example: An apartment property manager told you they don’t rent top floor units to families with children.

components.title: Who do you believe discriminated against you?

components.html: If you believe discrimination is still occurring, provide the last date you experienced discrimination.
components.label: Content
If you believe discrimination is still occurring, provide the last date you experienced discrimination.
components.errorLabel: A date within the last year

components.html: HUD can only investigate housing discrimination complaints that occurred in the last year.
components.label: Content

components.html:
• I was denied a reasonable accommodation.
  • I was told an apartment wasn't available to rent when it was listed as available.
  • I was sexually harassed by my property manager.
  • I was retaliated against for filing a housing discrimination complaint.
